kp8:1.1_0: A person stores away their savings
kp8:1.2_0: in a deep pit by the water’s edge:
kp8:1.4_0: thinking, “It will be for me to be benefited.”
kp8:10.3_0: Whatever it is that they wish for
kp8:11.2_0: a good shape, and good appearance,
kp8:12.2_0: the happiness of a Wheel-Turning Monarch,
kp8:12.3_0: even divine kingship in the heavens:
kp8:15.2_0: and I am a disciple of disciples.
kp8:15.3_0: the plane of a Buddha awakened for themselves:
kp8:16.3_0: That’s why the wise and the astute
kp8:2.1_0: free me from rulers if I am slandered,
kp8:2.3_0: or to release me from debt,
kp8:2.4_0: or in case of famine or losses.”
kp8:2.6_0: get stored away for such reasons.
kp8:3.1_0: But no matter how well stored away they are
kp8:3.2_0: in a deep pit by the water’s edge:
kp8:3.4_0: to aid them all the time.
kp8:4.1_0: For perhaps those savings are removed from there,
kp8:4.2_0: or they forget what marks the site,
kp8:4.3_0: or dragons make off with them,
kp8:5.3_0: When their merit is used up,
kp8:7.1_0: At a shrine or with the Saṅgha,
kp8:8.3_0: We must go on leaving all behind,
kp8:8.4_0: only this you take when you go.
kp8:9.1_0: You don’t have to divide it with others,
kp8:9.2_0: no thief makes off with your savings.
kp8:9.3_0: A wise person would make merit,
kp8:9.4_0: the savings that stay with you.
